paragraphs.text:
%python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
pd.__version__

%python print('%html

Please enter your occupation and state of residence:

')

msg.data: Please enter your occupation and state of residence:

paragraphs.text:
%python df_anzsco = pd.read_pickle('/data/pickles/anzsco_small.pkl') anzsco_codes = df_anzsco['ANZSCO'].unique() states = df_anzsco['State'].unique() state_names= ['Australian Capital Territory', 'New South Wales', 'Victoria', 'Queensland', "Tasmania",'South Australia', 'Northern Territory', 'Western Australia'] state_abbr= ['ACT', 'NSW', 'VIC', 'QLD', 'TAS', 'SA', 'NT', 'WA'] state_dict = {x:state_names[i] for i,x in enumerate(state_abbr)} anzsco_dict_vals = df_anzsco[['ANZSCO', 'ANZSCO Name']].sort_values(by='ANZSCO Name').drop_duplicates().values anzsco_dict = {x[0]: x[1] for x in anzsco_dict_vals} user_anzsco_code = z.select("Occupation (ANZSCO Unit Group)", anzsco_dict_vals) user_state = z.select("State", list(zip(state_abbr, state_names)) ) user_anzsco_name = anzsco_dict[str(user_anzsco_code)] user_state_name = state_dict[user_state] user_anzsco_minorgroup = user_anzsco_code[:3] print('%html

{} in {}

'.format(user_anzsco_name, user_state_name)) df_user = df_anzsco[(df_anzsco['ANZSCO']==user_anzsco_code) & (df_anzsco['State']==user_state)][df_anzsco.columns[4:]] df_user_state = df_user[['Average Salary ($) (State)', 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) (State)','Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years (State)']] df_user_national = df_user[['Average Salary ($) (National)', 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) (National)','Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years (National)']] df_user_summary = pd.DataFrame(data = np.concatenate([df_user_state.values,df_user_national.values]).T, columns = ['State','National'], index=['%html

{}

'.format(x) for x in ['Average Salary ($)', 'Predicted Wage Growth Over Next 5 Years ($)', 'Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years']]) df_user_summary = df_user_summary.reset_index() df_user_summary.columns = [' ', user_state_name,'National'] z.show(df_user_summary)

paragraphs.text:
%python print('%html

Looking for similar jobs in your field?

') print('%html Are you looking to make a career change? You can sort by any of the columns. For example, you might be interested in looking at careers which have many new job openings in the future; or you might be interested in career paths that offer high wage growth.') user_anzsco_minorgroup df_tmp = df_anzsco[(df_anzsco['ANZSCO Minor Group']==user_anzsco_minorgroup) & (df_anzsco['State']==user_state)][[ 'ANZSCO', 'ANZSCO Name', 'Average Salary ($) (State)', 'Average Salary ($) (National)', 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) (State)', 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) (National)', 'Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years (State)', 'Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years (National)'] ] df_tmp.columns = ['ANZSCO', 'ANZSCO Name', 'Average Salary ($) ({})'.format(user_state_name), 'Average Salary ($) (National)', 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) ({})'.format(user_state_name), 'Predicted 5-Year Wage Growth ($) (National)', 'Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years ({})'.format(user_state_name), 'Predicted New Jobs Over Next 5 Years (National)'] df_tmp.values[:,2:] = df_tmp.values[:,2:].astype(np.float) # This is needed because sometimes Zeppelin wants to interpret the entire table as strings z.show(df_tmp)

paragraphs.text:
%python
df_timeseries = pd.read_pickle('/data/pickles/anzsco_timeseries_salary_with_5y_predictions.pkl')
anzsco_codes = list(df_tmp['ANZSCO'].values)
df_timeseries_codes = df_timeseries.columns
common_codes = list(set(anzsco_codes).intersection(set(df_timeseries_codes)))

df_timeseries_tmp = df_timeseries[common_codes].transpose().copy()
df_timeseries_tmp.values = df_timeseries_tmp.astype(np.double)
if len(common_codes)>0:
    z.show(df_timeseries[common_codes].transpose())
